title: Why did Hitler follow a foreign policy to undo the clauses of the Treaty of Versailles? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because he was a German supremacist who sought to create a vast German empire stretching from the Rhine (later the Seine) to the Urals.The Versailles Treaty had put some restraints on German power.Getting rid of those restraints was the first step in establishing that empire.Chamberlain (and others) believed that getting rid of those restraints was actually Hitler’s ultimate objective rather than a necessary preliminary to his true objective.(Had they read Mein Kampf they would not have made such an error.)

The Treaty of Versailles was the treaty that never should have been. Its dictates were of the 19th Century and the terms of it came back to haunt its originators. No War reparations should have been demanded (because ALL of Europe was responsible for WW I via the chain of alliances), The League of Nations should have been backed up with authority and rebuilding should have been top priority. Alsace Lorraine was French. Poland should have been recreated but league of Nation plebiscites should have been held in ethnic conclaves. The A-H Empire needed to be broken up but Austria and Hungary should have been the only formed nations. Plebiscites should have been held there too. Note: If the USA had shored up its banking system in the 1920’s, The Great Depression might have only been a recession and without the economic ruin that hit Europe, WW II might have been avoided.
